200.description: Set the Shipping Address of the Line Item. Appropriate only when the Address is not to be saved/reused. To use a Saved Address (i.e. from the Addresses resource), PATCH the Line Item's ShippingAddressID property instead.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the line item. Possible values: Incoming, Outgoing.

200.description: Partially update the Shipping Address of the Line Item. Not allowed on unsubmitted Line Items where ShippingAddressID has been set. In that case, use the Addresses resource to update the Saved Address.

parameters.description: Direction of the line item. Possible values: Incoming, Outgoing.

201.description: Create a new Shipment containing all Line Items from this Order.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the order. Possible values: Incoming, Outgoing.

200.description: Set the Shipping Address of all Line Items on the Order. Appropriate only when the address is not to be saved/reused. To use a saved Address (i.e. from the Addresses resource), PATCH the Order's ShippingAddressID property instead..Note that this is a *shortcut* to setting each Line Item's Shipping Address indidually. Shipping Addresses are an Item-level concept; new Items added to the Order will *not* automatically inherit this Address. Additonally, the ShippingAddressID is write-only-- while you can set the shipping address for all the line items on the order using it, you will never see the address ID returned on the order body.s

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the order. Possible values: Incoming, Outgoing.

200.description: Partially update the Shipping Address of all Line Items on the Order. Not allowed on unsubmitted orders where ShippingAddressID has been set on any Line Items. In that case, use the Addresses resource to update the Saved Address..Note that this is a *shortcut* to updating each Line Item's Shipping Address indidually. Shipping Addresses are an Item-level concept.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the order. Possible values: Incoming, Outgoing.

200.description: Set the Billing Address of the Order. Appropriate only when the address is not to be saved/reused. To use a saved Address (i.e. from the Addresses resource), PATCH the Order's BillingAddressID property instead.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the order. Possible values: Incoming, Outgoing.

200.description: Partially update the Billing Address of the Order. Not allowed on unsubmitted Orders where BillingAddressID has been set. In that case, use the Addresses resource to update the Saved Address.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the order. Possible values: Incoming, Outgoing.

201.description: Add a Promotion to an Order.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the order. Possible values: Incoming, Outgoing.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the order. Possible values: Incoming, Outgoing.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the order. Possible values: Incoming, Outgoing.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Word or phrase to search for.

parameters.name: searchOn
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of fields to search on.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of fields to sort by.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page of results to return. Default: 1

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. Default: 20, max: 100.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Any additional key/value pairs passed in the query string are interpretted as filters. Valid keys are top-level properties of the returned model or 'xp.???'

204.description: Sends a temporary verification code via email, which must subsequently be passed in a Reset Password call.

parameters.name: verificationCode
parameters.description: Verification code of the forgotten password.
